channel.title: Sleeping issues
channel.description: I have serious issues with sleeping. It's almost impossible for me to sleep. I always hear a loud ringing in my ears that almost literally drives me insane. I'm not sure if it's related to me going partially deaf from loud music two years ago, but I would have thought the effects had worn off by now. How can I solve the problem? If it's completely silent I will start to writhe in agony over the noise because it is unbearable.

item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

But don’t the strange ones stick out? Its so fun xD

Dammit, I want to dream tonight but I’m NOT staying up another hour just to remember a damn dream when I need to get up early tomorrow.

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

rip4d:

Oh yeah, don’t use any electronics (TVs, cell phones, handhelds, computers, etc) for an hour before going to sleep. This will help you fall asleep easier, and you will have an incredibly increased dream recall (remembering dreams after waking up), which can be fun, especially if you learn to go lucid.

i never forgot a dream in my life actually(well after waking up then i choose to forget em cause i can) kinda gets annoying when i have nightmares lol

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @Liquid_Magic Liquid Magic
item.description:
@Liquid_Magic wrote:

I’ve had this problem before. This is caused by a lot of what is stated above :. Make sure your room isn’t a fucking bunker on lock-down. Keep all of your doors and windows open, or at least cracked. Even keeping the closet door open can help.

and suggestions above will help you even more than mine will…

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

I had a terrible night sleep last night, I’ve been under much stress lately and last night was the worse. I kept waking up feeling like I was in a trance and feeling sick, totally horrible experience.

I suggest, if you are having this often to go and see a doctor, their the only person who can help you.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @rant rant
item.description:
@rant wrote:

[quote=“Cole1497, post:1, topic:392166”]I have serious issues with sleeping.
It’s almost impossible for me to sleep. I always hear a loud ringing in my ears that almost literally drives me insane.
I’m not sure if it’s related to me going partially deaf from loud music two years ago, but I would have thought the effects had worn off by now.
How can I solve the problem? If it’s completely silent I will start to writhe in agony over the noise because it is unbearable.[/quote]
get a white noise machine…
I’m half deaf (no hearing in my right ear) i have sleep apnea (severe) and i have resless leg syndrom. So basically what i am saying is all you need is a noise machine, it works for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @Wintercanon Wintercanon
item.description:
@Wintercanon wrote:

[quote=“X Entinity X, post:22, topic:392166”]I sleep with a fan, not only because it kills the other noice around me but because I have less layers of skin and I get hotter then everyone else.

I have a skin problem (I get blisters on my hands and feet) but more easyer then other people.[/quote]Lesser layers of skin would cause your veins and arteries to be closer to the surface allowing them to dispel heat faster. You’d actually be colder than everyone else.

Read full topic

I’m telling, you… white noise.

That, and eating something non-sugary before bed can help. I get terrible hunger insomnia

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:16, topic:392166”]Tinnitus?
I know someone that suffers and it’s a serious problem though you can be treated![/quote]
How would I go about treating it?

Moparisthebest:

What if you sleep with some background noise like a fan blowing or something? Also, you probably want to get that checked out, it’s not normal and can probably be fixed, it might also be something really bad…

I tried this last night, and it didn’t do anything. The ringing seemed to become louder than the fan, so I tried the radio, and still nothing worked.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

Use white noise to fall asleep to or a loud fan. I grew up with it, so I actually can’t fall asleep without it. Also, if you have an iPod Touch, you can get these brainwave apps that can help you sleep.

Read full topic

item.title: Sleeping issues
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

In-ear headphones, whose sound enters directly into the ear canal, without any opportunity to be deflected or absorbed elsewhere, are a common cause of tinnitus when volume is set beyond modest or moderate levels.
OH SHIT

Read full topic
